greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n - product of nonzero digits of n.
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
N. J. A. Sloane and Brady Haran, Amazing Graphs II (including Star Wars), Numberphile video (2019).
maple: a:= n-> n-mul(i, i=subs(0=1, convert(n, base, 10))):
program: (PARI) ProdNzD(x)= { local(d,p); p=1; while (x>9, d=x-10*(x\10); if (d, p*=d); x\=10); return(p*x) }
{ for (n=1, 2000, write("b063543.txt", n, " ", n - ProdNzD(n)) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 25 2009
(PARI) a(n) = my(d=select(x->(x!=0), digits(n))); n - vecprod(d); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 13 2020
# _Elisabeth Zemack_, Sep 16 2019; corrected by _Fabio Somenzi_, Jan 13 2020
(MAGMA) [n - &*[a: k in [1..#Intseq(n)] | a ne 0 where a is Intseq(n)[k]]: n in [1..100]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Sep 16 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 14 2001
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Aug 14 2001
